title: The IMF Just Cut Its Global Growth Outlook Again. Here’s Why.
text:
The International Monetary Fund on Tuesday again cut its global economic forecast for the year to its slowest pace since the global financial crisis, citing a synchronized slowdown amid rising trade barriers and geopolitical tensions.

The revised 3% is a marked change from two years ago, when the world was in a synchronized upswing and growth was 3.8%. The latest downbeat outlook sets the stage for this week’s annual IMF meetings that draws global finance ministers and central bankers together in Washington, D.C., to discuss...
